revision.text: Possibly: An Introduction to the Study of History: Wherein is considered the Proper Method of Reading Historical Works, In order to acquire a Perfect Knowledge of Mankind; With a View to Improve the Judgment, and correct the various Errors arising from Passion and Prejudice. Exemplified in the Characters of Several Illustrious Personages Recorded in the Annals of Antiquity. By R. Johnson. (London : Printed for T. Carnan, at Number 65, in St. Paul's Church-Yard, M.DCC.LXXII. [1772]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2429869~S5
